oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-03-24 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 24, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Little Jimmy Dickens (host/performer), guest performer Hawkshaw Hawkins (although Red Sovine was advertised as the guest for this week on the previous show), and regular performers the Jordanaires, Dale Potter, Lew Childre, Del Wood, Rod Brasfield, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Little Jimmy Dickens; Jordanaires; Hawkshaw Hawkins; Dale Potter; Lew Childre; Del Wood
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Little Jimmy Dickens -- Salty Boogie (Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Little Jimmy Dickens introduces the Jordanaires -- Blow, Whistle, Blow (Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Little Jimmy Dickens introduces Hawkshaw Hawkins -- If It Ain't On The Menu (Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Little Jimmy Dickens introduces Dale Potter and Lew Childre -- Mississippi Sawyer (Dale Potter fiddle, Lew Childre calls) -- Little Jimmy Dickens talks -- Farther Along (Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Prince Albert jingle (Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Little Jimmy Dickens introduces Del Wood -- Down Yonder (Del Wood)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Brasfield, Rod; Wood, Del; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Potter, Dale; Jordanaires (Musical group); Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-; Hawkins, Hawkshaw, 1921-1963
